abstracts.cdata!:
The project gave mixed results, for
            although its outcome is satisfactory, sustainability is
            unlikely, given in part, that no mechanism is set to ensure
            retention of core skills, neither institutional mechanisms
            were created under the project in areas of management
            skills, procurement, and financial management matters.
            Hence, the institutional development impact is also
            affected, assessed as modest. Key lessons focus on the
            following areas: 1) institutionally, incremental efforts to
            strengthen the planning, and implementation capacity of the
            Ministry of Health (MOH), and of the Project Implementation
            Unit (PIU), produced good results, namely in the MOH's
            ability to design, and implement similar programs in the
            future, with minimal external assistance. However, the PIU
            should have played a facilitator's role for MOH
            programs, rather than an implementing authority, and, the
            Department of Health Services' key role in design,
            should have been taken into account, possibly as
            implementing agency, to mainstream with stakeholders, and
            coordinate implementation during the design phase; 2)
            technical, and social aspects, addressing the issue of staff
            security in isolated locations of certain health facilities,
            facilities which may well remain underused, or even unused,
            hampering service delivery. Moreover, the inadequacy of
            community consultations since the early planning stage,
            hindered ownership, and support, be it for the quality of
            construction, quality of care, or maintenance of health
            facilities; and, 3) operational issues, stipulating that
            while poor donor coordination, precluded the much-needed
            refresher training for maternal, and child health workers,
            responsiveness, teamwork, and flexibility led to outputs,
            which in several cases, exceeded expectations.
